description: recto: winged figure partially reclining on a curved element; figure holds a staff (?) in PR hand with outstretched arm; slightly foreshortened head; squared off in a grid; verso not examined--received framed
provenance: Otto Wessner, Saint-Gall, Switzerland. [Lorna Lowe/ Adolphe Stein, London, in 1972, as by Canuti]. [Claude Apcher, London]. Sir Timothy Clifford, United Kingdom. Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 3, 1989, no. 56, as Attributed to Francesco Solimena, for Â£3,000, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1989-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Fame (recto); Fame and Studies of Putti (verso)
